content.description:
Walk and scramble on the north ridge (as for Lookout Ridge) and drop down to a funky potholed sidewalk on the west side.

Follow the ledge to the chimney facing south.  Climb chimney then continue to the summit.

Climb down (or figure out a rappel anchor) the Lookout Ridge.

(Location and route description a best guess...feel free to add additional info).
content.location: Just past the start of Gonzo Dog Brains.

climbs.name: Lookout Ridge
climbs.fa: Likely the Indigenous Peoples of the Great Basin

content.description:
A classic fifth class scramble leading to a fine view summit.

Follow the ridge from the parking lot to the north.  When the angle steepens, scramble up and to the climber's right following the path of least resistance.

One thin section that demands a bit of paying attention.

Most folks solo up and down this rig, but, a rope would be prudent for the uninitiated.
content.protection: Standard rack and maybe a leaver sling if a rappel is desired (two ropes might be handy for the rappel).
content.location: Due north of the parking area.  Essentially the path of least resistance up the north ridge of the Lookout Rock formation.
